page.title: 18THE MILLS
page.content: Three of the old water mills were situated in the survey area. 1) Le Moulin de Grands Vaux Also known as Baxters Mill. This mill was working up to 1962 when it was knocked down to make way for a reservoir. 2) Le Moulin de Malassis. This means the badly sited mill. It was the only mill in Jersey not to have its own mill pond. It was burnt down in 1961 and the land on which it stood was given as a play area. This area is on the edge of Nicholson Park Housing Estate and is often used by children from the estate. 3) Paul Mill This was used up to the Second World war and the main building is still standing and is now being used as a house.
